meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Ashley Singh Dava-Leigh Brush Christina McTighe Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #7010.

td.p: Ashley Singh, a high school Spanish teacher from Louisville, Kentucky
Dava-Leigh Brush, a stay-at-home mom from Arnold, Missouri
Christina McTighe, a library associate from Washington, D.C. (whose 2-day cash winnings total $36,800)

tr.td: (Alex: We're all about TV fathers for [*]. We'll give you the father, you identify the show.)
(Alex: You have to name the present-day country where these narratives have taken place.)
(Alex: Featuring Spike TV's Jon Taffer of the show Bar Rescue.)

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'the Empire State Building

Dava-Leigh
')

div.h3: Scores at the first commercial break (after clue 15):
Scores at the end of the Jeopardy! Round:

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_DJ_5_1', 'clue_DJ_5_1_stuck', '(Alex Trebek reads the clue from the Smithsonian.) Higher than normal counters helped accommodate the 6\'2" height of this chef, who used this very kitchen not only privately, but also to achieve television fame--bon appetit !')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Alex Trebek reads the clue from the Smithsonian.) Higher than normal counters helped accommodate the 6'2" height of this chef, who used this very kitchen not only privately, but also to achieve television fame--bon appetit !

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_DJ_5_3', 'clue_DJ_5_3_stuck', '(Sarah of the Clue Crew reads the clue from the Peabody Museum in Cambridge, Mass.) The saddle probably belonged to this great Sioux leader who got $50 each time he rode once around the ring with Buffalo Bill\'s Wild West Show; preferring to die as an Indian rather than live as a white man, he returned to his people & was killed in 1890')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Sarah of the Clue Crew reads the clue from the Peabody Museum in Cambridge, Mass.) The saddle probably belonged to this great Sioux leader who got $50 each time he rode once around the ring with Buffalo Bill's Wild West Show; preferring to die as an Indian rather than live as a white man, he returned to his people & was killed in 1890

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Double Jeopardy! Round:

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: It might\'ve helped you if I had told you that it comes from the French.)
...
[Ashley was going for "ornate".]
...
(Alex: Flambé, [*]. [*].)
AshleyWhat is ornal
$7,400
Dava-LeighWhat is ornate?
$9,500
ChristinaWhat is ornate?
$13,900
flamboyant')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'Describing anything very showy, in architecture it refers to a style using curves like tongues of fire')

tr.td: Describing anything very showy, in architecture it refers to a style using curves like tongues of fire

body.div: The J! Archive is created by fans, for fans. The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law.
